preview: Morning Lee, Just confirming that these are now live on the website. Please let us know if you need any more assistance with this task.

full_threads.body:
Morning Lee, 

Just confirming that these are now live on the website. Please let us know if you need any more assistance with this task.

@heath All good now on this one. https://totalcontacts.com.au/product/probalance-toric-3/

I made made some updates on the script. The Below is the order for the default position of the list.
['-0.50', '+0.50', '-0.25', '+0.25', '0.00']

@rica +2hrs. Thanks!

oh, sorry, I should add:

Its important to note that many lenses do not have a 0.00 power, and may start at +0.50, -0.50....

so please bear in mind when resetting the dial so to speak not to include 0.00 for lenses where this power is not currently listed.

Thanks again, looks great
Lee

perfect!
thanks so much. Is that a long job to fix?

Lee:)

Hi Lee, 

Great news, we have coded up a solution in the staging site for you to review. Please visit this link: https://staging-totalcontacts2021.kinsta.cloud/product/air-optix-plus-hydraglyde-multifocal/ and let me know what you think?
@heath Yep, that should be fine.
@joel works well!! Can I send to the client to review?

@heath Let me know what you think on this one? 

https://staging-totalcontacts2021.kinsta.cloud/product/air-optix-plus-hydraglyde-multifocal/

Hi Lee, 

Glad you like the first part of the solution. 

I wouldn't say expensive, it's more so finding a way that works with your current setup. 

If you give me a couple of days, I will speak with our team and see if we can find a way to retrofit this functionality in for you.

action.text: Glen Tenorio assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body:
Thanks Heath
That's really good. In order to change the default spherical parameter to also show starting at around 0.00, showing low plus and minus, rather than the present default where it starts on the highest plus: to do this as well, that would be time consuming=expensive?

thanks
Lee

‌

Hi Lee,

Thanks for your patience for this. We have been trying to determine the best way to tackle this without having to recreate product data etc.

We have added in some descriptive copy as suggested, please have a look at this product and let me know what you think:
https://totalcontacts.com.au/product/air-optix-plus-hydraglyde-multifocal/

It does standout more, we could apply this to all of the relevant products, run it for a sample of around 2 weeks and see if this change helps.

Let me know what you think?

Thanks and speak soon,



Heath Maguire

From: Chris Paradowski <chris@wolfiq.com.au>

ID0EC
On 16 Nov 2021, at 10:55 am, Lee Baumwol - Total Eyecare <lbaumwol@totaleyecare.com.au> wrote:
Hey Chris,

Good to be on board with you guys again. Once you get all sorted with what u need, the first item we need to address is tweaking things to reduce incorrect "spherical power" errors, with patients typically ordering plus power instead of minus. We get one or 2 of these a week. To explain:

Each product has a spherical power. This power range varies from product to product (eg +4.00 to -6.00D). Some products (lenses for astigmatism and mulitfocals) have additional powers (cyl power or add power). These don't need changing. It's only the spherical power on every product that comes in either plus or minus powers. Our products, when u click on the "select" button for spherical power, (see random product selected below) shows the plus powers to the shopper, and u can scroll down to get to the minus powers. We need to draw attention to the shopper that the spherical power can be either plus or minus, and they should check which one their prescription is. One way of doing this, if it is easy, would be to change the range of parameters that shows initially when u click select, so rather than starting at the highest plus power, it starts around +0.50, +0.25. 0.00, -0.25 (note not all products have a 0.00 power). I note the specsavers website does this (shown in snip below ours).

An alternate would be a pop up on selecting spherical power " Insider tip: Have you checked if your power is plus or minus?"

Happy to take your thought on most efficient way to fix it at your end (or if its simple either way) and best way for the consumer

Thanks again
Lee
<image.png>


<image.png>


Lee Baumwol
Optometrist
